description.narrative: The development objective of the Shandong Ecological Afforestation Project for China will be to demonstrate effective afforestation models for environmentally degraded areas in support of Shandong's environmental afforestation programs. There are two components to the project. The first component of the project is environmental plantation establishment. This component will be implemented in 30 selected counties of Shandong province and will include two sub-components: (a) re-vegetation of degraded mountainous areas through planting of tree and shrub vegetation on highly degraded hillsides with a shallow soil cover; and (b) establishing protection forest plantations on saline coastal areas by planting trees and shrubs along roads, canals, and in areas designated for afforetation to protect agricultural land, improve productivity, and stabilize the newly created alluvial land near the mouth of the Yellow River. The second component of the project is technical support and project management. This component will support: (a) upgrading nurseries to propagate wider number of shrub and tree species including improving seedling quality, nursery equipment, onsite irrigation system (sub-lateral or smaller ditches), as well as providing training to small nurseries in nursery management and seedling requirements; (b) applied research, extension, and dissemination programs to generate and disseminate a wider range of species and planting techniques; and (c) strengthening the capacity of project implementing agencies at the provincial and local levels in project management, and monitoring and evaluation through the provision of technical assistance, training, and study tours. The latter will monitor project performance, achievement of project objective, and assess the project's environmental and socio-economic impact.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :PA, Section I, para 2 | Description :Shandong shall prepare an annual work program and budget plan for projectactivities in the following calendar year by Dec 15 of each year. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :PA, Section I, Para 6 | Description :Shandong shall ensure that the Project is carried out in accordance withthe provisions of the Anti-Corruption Guidelines. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA, Section I, para 1 (a)(b)(c)(d) | Description :Shandong shall maintain until project completion:(a)ProjectLeading Group(PLG), (b)Provincial PMO, (c)Prefecture and county level PLGs, (d)Prefecture and Country level PMOs. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA, Section I, para 3 (a)(b) | Description :Shandong shall apply the implementation of Project ImplementationPlan (PIP) and Participatory Planning Manual, and shall not amend,suspend or waive them or any part without prior WB agreement. |Frequency :Quarterly
Finance Agreement :PA, Section I, para 4 | Description :Shandong shall ensure subproject sites are selected according to criteriaset out the PIP. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :PA, Section II, para A, 1 | Description :Shandong shall prepare semi-annual project progress reports. Eachreport covers the period of one calendar semester, and be furnished to the Bank not laterthan Feb 15 and Aug 15 of each year. |Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :PA, Section II, para A,2 | Description :Shandong shall prepare the mid-term report on the progress achieved, byno later than Aug 15, 2013. | Due Date :15-Aug-2013

title.narrative: Number of draft technical recommendations/guidelines developed and adopted

Areas of degraded mountain revegetation established: limestone areas

Increased number of plant species growing on project sites (No.) (a) degraded mountainous area
Improvement in environmental conditions: (a) decrease in soil erosion in mountainous area (percentage of baseline)
Improvement in environmental conditions: (b) decrease in wind velocity at 5-10 time of tree height (percentage of baseline)
Number of different local tree and shrub species available in the project areas
Increase of vegetative cover (tree, grass, and shrub) in project sites (%) (a) Degraded mountainous area
Increased number of plant species growing on project sites (No.) (b) saline coastal area
Increase of vegetative cover (tree, grass, and shrub) in project sites (%) (b) saline coastal area
